newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA OTC MARKET TURNOVER FALLS.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA OTC MARKET TURNOVER FALLS.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) market turnover fell to 16.7 billion lei this week from the 25.4 billion lei from the previous lei.
A firming leu currency affected the OTC market, with a lack of interest from foreign investors and pushed turnover down.
"Foreign investors await better exchange rates to make new investments," one trader said.
Some 8 million shares changed hands on the RASDAQ -- the Romanian OTC system modelled on the U.S. NASDAQ -- slighty down from 8.9 million the previous week.
Cement maker Romcim SA which was investors' main target in the past weeks ended on Friday 307 lei firmer to close at 34,307 lei and took some 66 percent of the week's turnover.
The independent VAB-RASDAQ index, computed by Vanguard SA securities, rose 7 points on the week to 1,616.7.
The RASDAQ, which opened last October to eventually trade 5,000 companies privatised under a mass selloff, now lists 2,669 stocks. It traded an average 327 companies this week. ($=7,744 lei)
